data.scheme_name: Maharashtra New Tourism Policy 2024 -Fiscal Incentives-All Non MSME-Existing
data.benefits: The scheme offers large, mega, and ultra-mega units full SGST reimbursement, electricity duty and tariff exemptions, interest subvention, certification reimbursements, sustainability support, and stamp duty and registration charge exemptions.
data.eligibility: All large, mega & ultra mega tourism projects are eligible under this scheme
data.conditions:
All eligible units must be registered with the Department of Tourism (DoT) or the Ministry of Tourism (MoT), Government of India. Use of the DoT booking platform, if available, is compulsory. 

Eligible units must have either obtained or applied for a Provisional Registration Certificate under the Tourism Policy 2024.
data.beneficiaries: All large, mega & ultra mega tourism projects are eligible under this scheme
data.prerequisites:
All eligible units must be registered with the Department of Tourism (DoT) or the Ministry of Tourism (MoT), Government of India. Use of the DoT booking platform, if available, is compulsory. 

Eligible units must have either obtained or applied for a Provisional Registration Certificate under the Tourism Policy 2024.
data.context:
This Scheme is started by Government of Maharashtra, with an aim to create an encouraging and conducive environment for private Investment in tourism sector of the State. 

Also, Promote the state as preferred tourist destination. Development of tourism infrastructure. Facilitate investments in the tourism sector.
data.objective: The Maharashtra Tourism Policy 2024 aims to position Maharashtra as a premier global tourism destination by attracting investment, boosting economic contribution, and promoting sustainable and diverse tourism.
data.description:
The scheme provides the following benefits for Large, Mega, and Ultra Mega units: SGST reimbursement of up to 100% of net paid SGST 

Electricity duty exemption of up to 100% of the amount paid 

Electricity tariff refund of up to 100% of the amount paid 

Interest subvention of up to 5%, with a maximum of Rs. 75 lakhs 
Reimbursement of up to 100% or Rs. 2 lakhs for national certification and Rs. 10 lakhs for international certification 

Sustainability initiatives incentive of up to 25% of the capital investment, capped at Rs. 25 lakhs 

Stamp duty and registration charges exemption of up to 100% of the amount paid.
data.how_to_apply: Applicant have to apply online on Ministry of Tourism portal of Maharashtra portal or by going to regional Directorate of Office portal.
data.funding_mechanism: Incentives shall be released on approval of application by the concerned authority
data.additional_info:
MSME classification:

Micro projects: Minimum Investment Up to Rs. 100 lakhs and Minimum Direct Employment generation Up to 10 employees. #

Small projects means Minimum Investment Up to Rs.1000 lakhs and Minimum Direct Employment generation Up to 15 employees. 

Medium projects means Minimum Investment Up to Rs. 500 lakhs and Minimum Direct Employment generation Up to 25 employees. 

Other Units: Large projects: Minimum Investment Up to Rs. 5000 lakhs up to Rs. 10000 lakhs. 

Mega projects: Minimum Investment from Rs. 10000 lakhs up to Rs. 50000 lakhs and Minimum Direct Employment generation from 50 to 400 employees. 

Ultra Mega projects: Minimum Investment from Rs. 50000 lakhs and Minimum Direct Employment generation from 800 employees. 

Zonal Classification: 

Zone A : Mumbai, Thane, Navi Mumbai Municipal Area 

Zone B : Nasik, Pune, Aurangabad, Nagpur Municipal Corporation 

Zone C : Rest of the Maharashtra Specially Declared Tourism Zones
data.checklist_info_a:
Project Proposal: Detailed project plan including objectives, scope, and expected outcomes.
Registration and Licensing: Proof of business registration and necessary licenses.
Financial Documents: Financial statements, funding sources, and investment plans.
Land and Property Documents: Ownership or lease agreements for the land or property involved.
Environmental Clearances: Approvals from relevant environmental authorities.
NOC from Local Authorities: No Objection Certificates from local governing bodies.
Insurance Documents: Proof of insurance coverage for the project.
Compliance Certificates: Certificates ensuring compliance with local laws and regulations.
Tax Documents: GST registration and other relevant tax documents.
Employee Details: Information about the workforce, including qualifications and roles.
data.checklist_info_d:
Address- Directorate of Tourism​, Sakhar Bhavan, 4th Floor, Plot No. 230, Nariman Point, Mumbai – 400021
Contact Info- +91-9403878864
